text: Minsk Voblasc (Province) or Minsk Oblast is a province (voblast) of Belarus. The administrative center is Minsk. As of 2019, the voblast's population is 1,503,000, which has 15.3% of the national total. In the northern part of the oblast is the Lake Narach, the largest lake of the country. There are 22 districts (raions), 307 selsovets, 22 cities, 8 city municipalities, and 20 urban-type settlements. Minsk Region covers 39,900 km², which stands about 19.44% of the total area of Belarus Republic. There is the largest lake in the country called Narach in the Minsk Region. ==References== ==Other websites== *Minsk Region – The Heart Of Belarus Category:Regions of Belarus
title: Minsk Region
